column3: What brings you to Twine, if you don't mind me asking?
Though we no longer have that wretched Light constantly glaring down upon us, precious little else has changed around here. Most of us are still living hand-to-mouth no matter how hard we work.
So much for the return of the night sky! It was good while it lasted, I suppose. At any rate, it's all the same when you're breaking rocks in some mine.
Is the Light gone for good this time? I bloody well hope so.
What kind of place is this?
Like most people around here, I'm a miner.
It's all I know, and to be perfectly honest, there isn't much else <Emphasis>to</Emphasis> know in Amh Araeng.

Not many people are aware of this─even those who live here─but Twine was built through the combined efforts of the Ronso and Mystel. The name of this town comes from the idea of their tails being entwined together.
You don't see much cooperation between them these days, though. Most of the Mystel moved to Eulmore years ago and there are only one or two left now.
We Ronso, on the other hand, don't give up so easily. As long as there is work to be done, we'll be here.
